wikipedia_page.main: Abraham Brownrigg (b. Ballypierce 3 December 1836 – d Kilkenny 1 October 1928) was an Irish Roman Catholic prelate, who served as the Bishop of Ossory from 1884 until his death.Brownbrigg was educated at St Peter's College, Wexford and St Patrick's College, Maynooth. He was ordained priest on 21 April 1861. He was principal of St Aidan's Academy, Enniscorthy, Co. Wexford, and then at St Peter's in the same county. He was consecrated a bishop on 14 December 1884.
